item.description: This doc has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. We recommend using Stash to backup & restore MongoDB database. New to KubeDB? Please start here. Database Snapshots This tutorial will show you how to take snapshots of a KubeDB managed MongoDB database. Note: The yaml files used in this tutorial are stored in docs/examples/mongodb folder in GitHub repository kubedb/docs. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.

item.title: Use Stash to Backup MongoDB
item.description: Use Stash to Backup MongoDB Stash by AppsCode is a Kubernetes operator for backup and recovery of Kubernetes stateful workloads. Stash v0.9.0+ supports backup and restoration of MongoDB databases. KubeDB v0.13.0+ comes with built-in support for Stash. We recommend to use Stash for backup and restore your MongoDB databases instead of KubeDB’s native method. This guide will give you an overview of why you should use Stash to backup and restore your MongoDB databases.
